Woojin Shin

AI Researcher

I’m a master’s student in Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul.

My main research interests lie in:
• AI Safety: Adversarial Robustness, AI Alignment, AI Misuse Prevention
• Lightweight AI: Inference Acceleration, Model Compression, On-Device AI

During my graduate studies, I conducted research on the topics above. This work led to publications that address adversarial attacks against vision systems and inference acceleration for time-critical environments. For more details, please refer to my CV.

Conference Publications

[IJCAI'25] BankTweak: Adversarial Attack against Multi-Object Trackers by Manipulating Feature Banks

W. Shin, D. Kang, D. Choi, B. B. Kang, J. Lee and H. Baek

Proposed BankTweak, a novel adversarial attack on multi-object tracking (MOT) that manipulates feature banks rather than object positions, overcoming the limitations of prior methods that are easily neutralized by Mahalanobis-threshold tuning and suffer from low stealth due to increased false positives and false negatives.

Preprints

  • W. Shin, D. Kang, B. Park, B. B. Kang, J. Lee and H. Baek, "CF-DETR: A Coarse-to-Fine Transformer for Real-Tie Object Detection". under review
  • D. Kang, W. Shin, C. Hong, M. Koo, B. B. Kang, J. Lee and H. Baek, "Real Time Scheduling Framework for Multi Object Detection via Spiking Neural Networks". under review
